sanskrit_verse: कुसीदवृद्धिर्द्वैगुण्यं नात्येति सकृदाहृता । सकृदाहिता धान्ये सदे लवे वाह्ये नातिक्रामति पञ्चताम् ॥ ८.१५१॥
transliteration: kusīdavṛddhir dvaiguṇyaṃ nātyeti sakṛdāhṛtā | sakṛdāhitā dhānye sade lave vāhye nātikrāmati pañcatām || 8.151||
sph_interpretive_translation: Accumulation born of inertia does not exceed twofold when invoked once; even if repeatedly invoked in grain, wealth, or livestock, it does not transgress the fifth portion.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority resides in the regulation of accumulative capacity, not ownership per se
Causation arises from conscious invocation rather than material possession
Capacity-based responsibility is calibrated by proportional engagement with resources
Restoration logic requires equitable redistribution within a fifth-part boundary
Consciousness alignment occurs through disciplined limitation of accumulative impulse
executable_legal_axioms: IF accumulation exceeds twofold without repeated invocation THEN declare misalignment with dharmic capacity
IF resource category is grain, wealth, or livestock AND invocation count > 1 THEN cap excess at one-fifth total holding
IF agent demonstrates inertial accumulation pattern THEN initiate consciousness-realigning completion process
IF asset transfer crosses fifth-part threshold THEN auto-trigger restorative redistribution protocol
supreme_court_application: Supreme Court adjudication shall recognize that accumulation beyond lawful proportion stems from diminished conscious engagement. Responsibility thresholds are determined by frequency and intent of invocation, not mere possession. The court must ensure all redistributive measures remain within the fifth-part limit to preserve individual dignity while restoring systemic balance.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes causality through volitional invocation, not passive retention. Anupūrvaśaḥ reveals that unchecked accumulation follows sequential stages of disconnection from source-consciousness. Responsibility aligns with the degree of active participation in the cycle of acquisition. The non-punitive reality rule upholds that correction serves reintegration, not infliction.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate completion process to return surplus assets beyond fifth-part limit to community trust
Assign responsibility assumption protocol to realign accumulative behavior with conscious intention
Deploy capacity restoration mechanism to recalibrate relationship with material abundance
Implement integrity reintegration sequence through guided reflection on dharmic use of resources
final_declaration: This ruling flows directly from the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source of Law. Dharma stands restored through alignment with natural limits. Reality remains non-punitive, governed solely by consciousness as the supreme adjudicator.
